title: [BEAM-2281] Improve SQL expression testing so SQL syntax tests suffice; delete extraneous unit tests
body:
Previously, we had unit tests because we implemented a lot of standard functions from scratch. Now we use Calcite's implementations and we don't need tests for them. We need some smoke tests that we have plumbed things correctly. The SQL syntax tests are more more concise and work well for that (and actually for all purposes).

To make this feasible, the base testing infrastructure needed a tweak to give more informative errors, by having separate asserts for each test case.

title: [BEAM-3608] WIP: Vendored Guava 20
body:
This adds a module `beam-vendor-guava-20` that is just a namespaced redistribution of Guava 20.0. We would then depend on and ship this.

Benefits

 - Faster build, since we don't shade every project, only these vendor modules (which actually are very fast because there are far fewer classes being scraped)
 - Smaller jars, since we don't copy Guava 10x+
 - We can just ban a direct Guava dep easily
 - Trivial to verify that jar is 1:1 with namespace
 - Readable code because it doesn't get modified during build
 - You can actually use two versions and adapt between them if you need to

Reference: https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/12383d2e5d70026427df43294e30d6524334e16f03d86c9a5860792f@%3Cdev.beam.apache.org%3E

Open questions:

 - Should I put minor version in everything? Technically it shouldn't be needed, but in practice I imagine it could be.

------------------------

title: [BEAM-2939, BEAM-3743, BEAM-3833] Supports SDF in Reference Runner
body:
Minor changes:
* Adds DelayedApplication
* Adds PROCESS_ELEMENTS
* Changes key type of PROCESS_KEYED_ELEMENTS, SplittableParDoViaKeyedWorkItems, and everything related to be byte[], so that it can be portable (non-Java SDKs don't understand String)

Major changes runner side:
* In ReferenceRunner, adds two pipeline transformations for executing SDFs:
** Replaces SPLITTABLE_PROCESS_KEYED with a GBKO, followed by a runner-specific "feed" transform (`KWI<byte[], KV<InputT, RestrictionT>>` -> `KV<InputT, RestrictionT>`), followed by PROCESS_ELEMENTS.
** Then fusion happens, and after that we replace "feed" followed by an ExecutableStage with a runner-specific "splittable remote stage" transform. It's a transform that takes KWI's and feeds them into an ExecutableStage where it is assumed that the stage starts with a PROCESS_ELEMENTS transform.
* Introduces an evaluator for the latter: SplittableRemoteStageEvaluatorFactory. It works almost exactly like ProcessFn used to (via state and timers - encapsulated into a runner-agnostic utility class SDFFeederViaStateAndTimers), but portably, according to the https://s.apache.org/beam-breaking-fusion protocol.

Major changes Java harness side:
* Introduces BundleSplitListener, which any PTransform can invoke to signal that it has split itself.
* Makes ProcessBundleHandler collect the splits and ship them to the runner via progress updates.
* Refactors FnApiDoFnRunner into two helper classes: DoFnPTransformRunnerFactory that contains various bookkeeping logic (e.g. wiring inputs and outputs, instantiating coders), and FnApiStateAccessor that contains logic for accessing state and side inputs.
* Removes a bunch of dead code from FnApiDoFnRunnerFactory (start/finish bundle contexts don't need to implement ArgumentProvider)
* Removes also the old Factory from FnApiDoFnRunner, and refactors its tests to use the PAR_DO transform and the new factory in all cases
* Introduces SplittableProcessElementsRunner which also uses DoFnPTransformRunnerFactory for bookkeeping, StateAccessor for side inputs (which I haven't tested), and runs the SDF and invokes BundleSplitListener when it splits.

Of all this, a different runner could reuse:
* The runner-agnostic class SDFFeederViaStateAndTimers (I am not sure that the pipeline graph manipulation code will be equally reusable - we'll see about that when this gets added to Flink; but it's not directly reusable for Dataflow)
* All the Java harness code, of course

Reference runner is not yet a first-class "runner" capable of ValidatesRunner tests, so I added a hand-crafted test, copying the simplest possible SDF test.

title: DO NOT MERGE Merge trimmed beam site into main repository.
body:
```
git clone git@github.com:apache/beam-site.git
cd beam-site

# Remove content and auto-generated docs in src/documentation/sdks from the history.
git filter-branch --index-filter 'git rm -rf -q --ignore-unmatch content src/documentation/sdks/pydoc src/documentation/sdks/javadoc ' --prune-empty -f HEAD

# Re-write shorthand PR/issue links.
git filter-branch --msg-filter 'sed "s|#\([0-9][0-9]*\)|https://github.com/apache/beam-site/pull/\1|g"' -f HEAD

# Move everything to a beam-site subdirectory.
# NOTE: BSD sed (including OS X) does not support \t as tab.
git filter-branch --index-filter 'git ls-files -s | sed "s|\t|\tbeam-site/|" |
    GIT_INDEX_FILE=$GIT_INDEX_FILE.new \
    git update-index --index-info &&
    mv $GIT_INDEX_FILE.new $GIT_INDEX_FILE' -f HEAD

# Grab main repo and merge the site in.
git remote add github git@github.com:apache/beam.git
git fetch github
git checkout -b merge-beam-site github/master
git merge asf-site --allow-unrelated-histories
```

------------------------

title: [BEAM-4376] Add Nexmark events generation based on ParDo
body:
R: @kennknowles 
CC: @jkff 

Hi, I ping you guys because I found something weird and I am not sure if it is a direct runner issue or a issue with ParDo (or a Nexmark thing that I didn't identify). I added this new generation mode for Nexmark to be able to test the PortableRunner. However when the Nexmark executions produce different results.
I print the generated events (the input of the different queries) and both (the ParDo based and the Source generator) produce exactly the same output (I validate this in `EventGeneratorDoFnTest#testGeneratesSameEvents`). 

Do you have any idea why this can be wrong? am I missing something that can change the results?
As a reference to execute this I do:
```
./gradlew :beam-sdks-java-nexmark:run \
    -Pnexmark.runner=":beam-runners-direct-java" \
    -Pnexmark.args="
        --runner=DirectRunner
        --streaming=false
        --suite=SMOKE
        --manageResources=false
        --monitorJobs=true
        --enforceEncodability=true
        --enforceImmutability=true --useParDoGenerator=true"
```
You can change useParDoGenerator to false to see the different results.

title: DO NOT MERGE: Demonstrate merging beam site into main repository
body:
This is a demonstration only. DO NOT MERGE

```
# link up beam-site
git remote add beam-site https://github.com/apache/beam-site.git
git fetch beam-site

# prep the beam-site to be in the subdirectory, with no content/
git checkout -b mv-site-to-subdir beam-site/asf-site
mkdir beam-site
git rm -r content/
git mv [^b]* beam-site/
git commit -m 'Move beam site to beam-site/ subdirectory'

# merge with to the main repo
git checkout -b merge-beam-site github/master
git merge mv-site-to-subdir --allow-unrelated-histories

# Fix conflicts in .gitignore and .gitattributes; if we do this we can rm them first
git merge --continue
```

title: [BEAM-4276] Add combiner lifting support to Go SDK
body:
Implements combiner lifting support to the Go SDK, for universal runners.

Per https://s.apache.org/beam-runner-api-combine-model, the Go SDK puts the URN and CombinePayload on the composite containing the basic unlifted combine implementation for runners which don't support the optimization. 

There are a few TODOs but I can lift them into JIRAs as necessary. Of note is that the current go implementation for Top uses an unencodable accumulator type (it contains []interface{}) so it is unable to be lifted at present. However, when this case is detected, the SDK will simply not add the URN and payload and continue with it's existing representation as a vanilla ParDo to runners.
